recipes.name: Sesame Noodles with Cucumber
recipes.description: Cold noodles with a savory sesame sauce and fresh cucumber - perfect for warm days.
ingredients: 12 oz Chinese egg noodles or spaghetti
instructions: Cook noodles according to package directions. Rinse under cold water and drain.
In a bowl, whisk together sesame oil, soy sauce, rice vinegar, peanut butter, tahini, brown sugar, garlic, and ginger until smooth.
Toss noodles with sauce until well coated.
Top with julienned cucumber, sliced green onions, and toasted sesame seeds.
Serve cold or at room temperature.
recipes.notes: Can be made ahead and refrigerated. Perfect for meal prep.

recipes.name: Korean Bibimbap
recipes.description: A colorful rice bowl topped with various vegetables, protein, and a spicy gochujang sauce.
ingredients: 1 lb ground beef or thinly sliced beef
1 cup bean sprouts, blanched and seasoned
instructions: Marinate beef in soy sauce, sesame oil, brown sugar, and garlic for 15 minutes.
Cook each vegetable separately: blanch spinach and bean sprouts, sauté carrots and zucchini.
Cook marinated beef until browned and cooked through.
Fry eggs sunny-side up.
Assemble bowls: rice on the bottom, arranged sections of vegetables and beef, topped with fried egg.
Serve with gochujang sauce on the side to mix in as desired.
recipes.notes: Can make components ahead of time and assemble when ready to eat.

recipes.name: Simple Chicken Ramen
recipes.description: A quick homemade ramen with chicken, vegetables, and a flavorful broth.
ingredients: Sesame seeds and chili oil for garnish
instructions: In a large pot, combine broth, soy sauce, garlic, ginger, and mirin. Bring to a simmer.
Add chicken breasts to the broth and simmer until cooked through, about 15 minutes.
Remove chicken, shred it, and set aside.
Cook ramen noodles according to package directions.
Divide noodles among four bowls, top with shredded chicken, spinach, carrots, and green onions.
Ladle hot broth over the ingredients.
Top each bowl with a halved soft-boiled egg, sesame seeds, and a drizzle of chili oil if desired.
recipes.notes: For kids, use less or no chili oil.

recipes.name: Chinese Scallion Pancakes
recipes.description: Flaky, savory pancakes filled with green onions - a perfect snack or appetizer.
ingredients: 1/4 cup vegetable oil, plus more for cooking
Dipping sauce: 2 tablespoons soy sauce, 1 tablespoon rice vinegar, 1 teaspoon sesame oil, pinch of sugar
instructions: Mix flour and salt in a bowl. Slowly add hot water while stirring until a dough forms.
Knead the dough for 5 minutes until smooth. Cover and rest for 30 minutes.
Divide dough into 4 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a thin circle.
Brush each circle with oil and sprinkle with chopped scallions.
Roll up each circle like a jelly roll, then coil it into a spiral. Flatten spiral with rolling pin.
Heat oil in a skillet and cook each pancake until golden brown on both sides, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Cut into wedges and serve with dipping sauce.
recipes.notes: Can be frozen before cooking for later use.

recipes.name: Korean Kimchi Fried Rice
recipes.description: A spicy, flavorful fried rice made with kimchi, perfect for using leftover rice.
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
If using meat, cook it first until browned.
Add kimchi and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add rice, kimchi juice, and soy sauce. Stir-fry, breaking up any clumps of rice.
Push rice mixture to one side and crack eggs into the empty side. Scramble eggs, then mix into rice.
Stir in sesame oil and green onions.
Serve hot, garnished with additional green onions and sesame seeds.
recipes.notes: Adjust kimchi amount based on spice preference.

recipes.name: Japanese Onigiri (Rice Balls)
recipes.description: Handheld rice balls with various fillings, perfect for lunch boxes or quick snacks.
ingredients: Fillings options: canned tuna mixed with mayo, pickled plum (umeboshi), grilled salmon flakes
2 sheets nori seaweed, cut into strips
instructions: Wet your hands and sprinkle with a little salt to prevent sticking.
Place about 1/3 cup of rice in your palm and create a small indentation.
Add 1 teaspoon of your chosen filling in the indentation.
Cover the filling with a little more rice and shape into a triangle or ball.
Wrap the bottom of the onigiri with a strip of nori.
Sprinkle with sesame seeds if desired.
recipes.notes: Great for meal prep and lunch boxes. Can be customized with different fillings.

recipes.name: Chinese Tomato Egg Stir-Fry
recipes.description: A simple, comforting dish of fluffy eggs stir-fried with sweet tomatoes.
instructions: Beat eggs with a pinch of salt.
Heat oil in a wok or skillet over medium-high heat.
Add eggs and scramble until just set but still moist. Remove from wok.
In the same wok, add tomatoes, sugar, and salt. Cook until tomatoes soften and release juices, about 2 minutes.
Return eggs to the wok and gently combine with tomatoes.
Add green onions and sesame oil. Stir briefly.
Serve hot with steamed rice.
recipes.notes: A quick, nutritious meal that comes together in minutes. Very authentic Chinese home cooking.

recipes.name: Korean Japchae (Glass Noodle Stir-Fry)
recipes.description: Sweet potato glass noodles stir-fried with vegetables and meat in a savory sauce.
ingredients: 2 cups spinach, blanched and squeezed dry
instructions: Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain, rinse with cold water, and toss with 1 tablespoon sesame oil.
If using beef, marinate with 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1 teaspoon sugar, and 1 teaspoon sesame oil for 15 minutes.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok. Stir-fry beef until cooked through, then remove from pan.
In the same pan, stir-fry onion, carrot, and bell pepper until softened.
Add garlic and cook until fragrant.
Add noodles, remaining soy sauce, sugar, and sesame oil. Toss to combine.
Add beef back to the pan along with blanched spinach. Toss everything together.
Garnish with sesame seeds before serving.
recipes.notes: Can be served hot or at room temperature. Great for parties.

recipes.name: Japanese Miso Soup
recipes.description: A simple, comforting soup made with miso paste, tofu, and seaweed.
ingredients: 4 cups dashi stock (or water with dashi powder)
instructions: Soak wakame in cold water for 5 minutes until reconstituted, then drain.
Bring dashi stock to a gentle simmer (do not boil).
Place miso paste in a small bowl and add a ladle of hot dashi. Whisk until smooth.
Add miso mixture back to the pot and stir gently.
Add tofu cubes and wakame. Simmer for 1 minute (do not boil after adding miso).
Ladle into bowls and garnish with green onions.
recipes.notes: Miso soup is traditionally served as a side dish with Japanese meals. Never boil miso as it destroys beneficial probiotics.

recipes.name: Chinese Congee (Rice Porridge)
recipes.description: A comforting rice porridge that's easy to digest and can be topped with various ingredients.
ingredients: 8 cups chicken or vegetable broth (or water)
Toppings (optional): sliced green onions, cilantro, shredded chicken, century egg, fried garlic, soy sauce
instructions: Combine rice, broth, ginger, and salt in a large pot.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low.
Simmer uncovered for about 1 hour, stirring occasionally, until rice has broken down and congee is creamy.
Add more water if needed to achieve desired consistency.
Season to taste and serve hot with desired toppings.
recipes.notes: Perfect for when you're feeling under the weather. Can be made in a slow cooker overnight.

recipes.name: Korean Kimchi Pancakes (Kimchijeon)
recipes.description: Crispy, savory pancakes made with fermented kimchi and a simple batter.
ingredients: Dipping sauce: 2 tablespoons soy sauce, 1 tablespoon rice vinegar, 1 teaspoon sesame oil
instructions: In a bowl, mix flour, water, egg, kimchi juice, and salt until smooth.
Fold in chopped kimchi and green onions.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Pour about 1/4 cup of batter into the pan and spread into a thin circle.
Cook until golden brown on the bottom, about 3-4 minutes.
Flip and cook the other side until crispy, about 2-3 more minutes.
Repeat with remaining batter.
Serve hot with dipping sauce.
recipes.notes: The pancakes are crispier if the batter is not too thick. Add a little more water if needed.

recipes.name: Chinese Steamed Egg Custard
recipes.description: A delicate, silky egg custard that's steamed to perfection.
ingredients: 3/4 cup warm water or chicken broth
instructions: Beat eggs with salt until just mixed (don't over-beat).
Slowly stir in warm water or broth (the liquid should be warm, not hot).
Strain the mixture through a fine sieve into a heatproof bowl.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or aluminum foil.
Set up a steamer and bring water to a boil, then reduce to a simmer.
Place the bowl in the steamer and steam for about 10 minutes until set but still jiggly in the center.
Drizzle with sesame oil and soy sauce, and garnish with green onions before serving.
recipes.notes: For the silkiest texture, make sure to steam over low heat. Excellent for children and easy to digest.
